feed.title: Tipi Releases
feed.subtitle: Self-hosted software releases generated by selfh.st

entry.title: New release for Tipi: v3.9.4
entry.content:
Release notes

Fixes - Fix login issue when the runtipi domain doesn't use a standard TLD

How to update

From the root folder of your runtipi install

  • ./runtipi-cli update v3.9.4

You can also set an auto update cron for future updates

If you are coming from version 2 or lower please follow the migration guide

Please report any issue you encounter so we can fix it immediately.

entry.title: New release for Tipi: v3.10.0
entry.content:
Release notes

features - Added a settings option to change log level. This lets users enter debug mode and have more logs - Added a new option for dynamic compose: extraLabels to add custom labels to a container with variable interpolation - Added the new options for volumes in dynamic compose: shared and private that respectively add the labels :z and :Z to the bind mount - Added the possibility to enable experimental flags from the settings.json file - Allow custom forward auth url in settings.json. Opening the system to other auth systems

Fixes - Properly render sysctls options in the generated compose

How to update

From the root folder of your runtipi install

  • ./runtipi-cli update v3.10.0

You can also set an auto update cron for future updates

If you are coming from version 2 or lower please follow the migration guide

Please report any issue you encounter so we can fix it immediately.

entry.title: New release for Tipi: v4.0.0
entry.content:
Release notes

This new release introduces a major change on how the apps file structure is managed. In order to support multiple and external app stores we made the following changes:

⚠️ Breaking changes - Runtipi requires now Docker to be on version 28 at least. Check with docker -v - Runtipi now requires all apps in the configured app-stores to adhere to the dynamic-config definition. If you are running the default app-store there is no action to take. If you run a custom app-store you'll need to migrate your custom apps to use this configuration. See https://runtipi.io/docs/reference/dynamic-compose - App data and app config are now stored in their repo subfolder. Example if you had an app installed it would be at runtipi/apps/nginx now there is a new subfolder for each appstore runtipi/apps/<my-store>/nginx - Secondary containers that come with apps (like databases) are now in their own isolated network and the main container will be bound to both the runtipi and the app specific network. Check your custom configs if you have any network configuration - Containers are now named according to docker's default scheme, we don't specifically name the container to the app name anymore. - App local domains are now including the app store name in the domain. Example: nginx.runtipi.local becomes nginx-migrated.runtipi.local

New features - Multiple app store support: Add your own repositories or community-created app stores - SSL certificates are now automatically re-created when expired

Improvements - Moved the runtipi-queue to its own container for increased reliability - Improved PWA (Progressive Web App) user experience - Added local domain to guest dashboard for easier app access - Multi-network support for more complex app setups and increased security - Better category selection with ability to clear filters - Apps automatically start on system boot if they were previously running

Fixes - Fixed timezone selector width - Fixed scrolling issues on guest dashboard

How to update

Follow the update instructions on our website

entry.title: New release for Tipi: v4.0.2
entry.content:
Release notes

Fixes - Fixed duplicate health check start policy preventing stack to start
